etymologies: Old English calcatrippe, denoting any plant which tended to catch the feet, from medieval Latin calcatrippa, from calx ‘heel’ or calcare ‘to tread’ + a word related to trap. caltrop (sense 1) was probably adopted from French

definitions: a spiked metal device thrown on the ground to impede wheeled vehicles or (formerly) cavalry horses

examples.text: militant demonstrators threw a box of caltrops across the highway

shortDefinitions: spiked metal device thrown on ground to impede wheeled vehicles

definitions: a creeping plant with woody carpels that typically have hard spines and resemble military caltrops.
shortDefinitions: creeping plant with woody carpels with hard spines
